Articles.Content:
When I start up the game, everything works fine and all my mods are there (is there supposed to be a Kethane map on the title screen?), but then when I open up my save file that I just created, it crashes whenever I try to go into the VAB (and I'd assume the SPH as well).

Mods:

B9 Aerospace

FAR

KW Rocketry

Interstellar

Kerbal Engineer

Kethane

Remote Tech 2

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement

Procedural Fairings

Here's the most recent error log:

http://pastebin.com/SN9fR99L

Couldn't get the output_log because none of the websites I used would let me paste 755 kb

In my limited experience with error logs, it would seem to be a lack of ram.

However, if that's incorrect, feel free to correct me.

Might be. I think game loads all parts to RAM in the VAB. I was experiencing better performance during simulation than in the VAB with more mods installed. Not using B9 mixed with KW since then.

You might try texture redux mods. Didn't try these myself.

Running B9 plus KW is pretty much a summons to the dark lords of out-of-memory crashes, at least in the current version of KSP. Have you tried using the low-resolution texture packs for both addons? Pulls the memory footprint down nicely.

(and yes there's supposed to be a kethane map on the title screen, I'd love to know how to turn that off myself)

You should get the Active texture reduction mod, especially if you are running all of B9

Edited February 4, 2014 by Taki117
Added Link
I have almost all of those and a few more besides. You're definitely needing the active texture reduction pack.
I was thinking it might be that, but I really had no idea. Thanks for the help!
